lines.text: Just an old pile of trash, it seems oddly relatable.
You can’t go there anymore. Your landlord kicked you out two weeks ago.
Oh hi there ! I didn’t expect to see anyone here I used to be the gravedigger around here, but since I died no one’s taking care of the graveyard anymore.
No one’s coming here anyway, but I wish I had more time to say goodbye to the skeletons, they’re some of the coolest people I’ve ever met.
Thanks again for the clock, the constant ticking kind of brought a bit of life back in this garden. It’s really nice.
No fish. No fish. I’m not looking for fish, I’m looking for something more personal.
I feel like I can see them on this lake.
Maybe it is just me here, it’s always been me right ?I try to find them everyday but I really can’t seem to get them.
Not the fish. I mean, I don’t know, maybe ? Maybe it was the fish all along.
It just won’t stop…
Hey, nice to see you ! It’s been a while, I haven’t seen you since the “landlord incident”.
Talking about that I found a way to get your house back. Are you down to do a “kind of silly prank” ?
Are you god ? Or my mom ? I can’t really tell, it’s so dark in here.
I’ve been lost in this cave for as long as I can remember.
It’s comfy tho, I like the humidity and the quietness.
I just wished I could see something.
Would you mind not telling people I’m here ? I kind of like being alone
Thank you so much! I can actually see your face now !
And wow, you’re kind of slaying that whole “bunch of stuff” look.

success.text: The shadows cast by the lantern remind me of humans, I don't know why.
